John Casablancas, Model and Talent Management

Collaborates with peers to enhance the instructional environment.Implements instructional activities that contribute to a climate where students are actively engaged in meaningful learning experiences. Assist in assessing changing curricular needs and offer plans for improvement.Ensures that student growth and achievement is continuous and appropriate for age group, subject area, and/or program classification.   Help students to be experts in runway, make-up, acting, and photo shoots.  Educate students with the modeling and entertainment industry.Recruit potential students’ to the agency.

Review information on Monster for potentials candidates in the area of Chicago, IL, Louisville, KY and Cincinnati OH.Develops and maintains a generic employee profile of campus specific applicant attributes to indentify needs, job specifications, job duties, qualifications, and skills. Develops and maintains a department skill summary instrument by reviewing job descriptions, job analyses and performance evaluations. Formulates and administers a campus recruitment strategy to identify effectively appropriate target audiences to attract new employee prospects.  This includes developing and maintaining effective contact methodologies to communicate with new employee prospects, as well as, serve as a liaison with prospect job applicants. Develop and administer an interdepartmental needs assessment system and feedback mechanism to ensure all campus-staffing needs are met in a timely, effective and efficient manner. Creates, implements and maintains a standardized screening instrument to match positive characteristics and specific job needs with prospective campus employees.  Conducts the initial screening and refers potential candidates for additional interview with campus managers and directors in the organization. Collects, assimilates and analyze employee exit interview results to identify overall trends over a period of time.  Presents research findings highlighting statistical data, trends, and individual comments to senior management as needed or requested.  Participates in the development and adherence of the departmental budget as it relates to staff recruitment and retention activities. Manage and track up to 100 candidates in all different stages of the selection process within the internal system of Faculty Center.Utilize critical thinking skills when reviewing CARs – content area requests, meeting the University’s accreditation standards.
Faculty Recruiter, University of Phoenix for local campuses in Chicago, IL, Cincinnati, OH, and Louisville, KY

University ServicesUtilize leadership skills by building and restoring relationships with institutions nationwide.Strive to improve the image of the University of Phoenix within the marketplace by offering world-class customer service.Research and follow-up on student transcript requests to ensure speedy processing and matriculation.Maintain student files by leaving appropriate and accurate notes.Maintain database with accurate and up-to-date contact for both the student and outside institutions.Daily report maintenance to follow up on admissions processing, transcript tracking, and matriculation.Respond to individual student problems, concerns, and questions within 24 hours.Responsible for maintaining and enforcing all policies and procedures set forth by the Department of Education and University Administration.
